title.narrative: Civique et Electorale de la Jeunesse (PECEJ)

description.narrative:
It is highly improbable to reach the First Millennium Development Goal if young people do not occupy politico-economic positions with a view to contribute to the reduction of poverty and hunger but also to allow youth representation at all national levels in order to have a better country.
in order to able to promote youth participation in the political and socio-economic fields.

Result 1: Youth involved in the program hired in the private sector Result 2: Public-private partnerships signed
Project outputs: - 26 senior leaders in network - 74 youth in network - 2 networks of young leaders created - 3 communication strategies developed - 2 case studies published - 1 event to launch campaign involving 50 leaders in the public-private sector and 73 young leaders is organized - 1 audio/visual song and 1 skit produced for the campaign - 5 video reports of organized events - 20 articles published - 80 radio commercials aired - 9 debates on radio and 3 TV debate shows with politicians and youth leaders broadcasted - More than 1800 listeners and 1200 viewers reached by campaigns and public debates - 2 Round tables with 12 policy makers in the public and private sector and 6 young leaders organized - 6 Lobbying meetings with 20 decision makers in public and private sector organized to advocate for internship opportunities for youth and for youth to be members of socio-economic policy and decision-making teams.

The Direct Beneficiaries of this project are:
Youth Leaders belonging to youth movements in political parties Youth leaders from religious denominations Representatives of youth centres Youth leaders from different universities Youth leaders from secondary schools Leaders of political parties Some state institutions (The ministry of youth, The Independant National Electoral Commission (CENI), The National Assembly, The senate, The Ministry of Finance, The Ministry of Labour) The chambers of commerce and industrial networks
